intro: Korthalsella emersa, commonly known as the upright korthalsia, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Korthalsella emersa is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental flowers.
